definition: to wade/to be involved/to concern/to experience/to enter (classical)

sentences.english: They traveled in quest of gold.
sentences.chinese: 他們爲尋找黃金而長途跋涉。

sentences.english: An actor circling the stage suggests a long journey.
sentences.chinese: 而演員繞臺奔走則代表長途跋涉。

sentences.english: After a long walk, he wore a black sweat.
sentences.chinese: 長途跋涉後，他出了一身臭汗。

sentences.english: Grumeti River is the only source of water on their long and tough journey.
sentences.chinese: 在這艱辛的長途跋涉中，格魯美地河是唯一的水源。

sentences.english: With a lack of IMAX theaters, people are traveling long distances to see the movie.
sentences.chinese: 由於IMAX影院稀缺，人們不惜長途跋涉。

sentences.english: He trudged20 miles through the deep snow.
sentences.chinese: 他在深雪之中跋涉了二十哩。

sentences.english: It has taken Jean Beliveau 11 years to make the trek.
sentences.chinese: 貝力弗花了11年來完成了他的長途跋涉。

sentences.english: I wade down a shallow pebbly stream daily.
sentences.chinese: 我每天沿着一條淺的有卵石的小溪跋涉。

sentences.english: We walk through the ponding with hard under the fierce storm.
sentences.chinese: 我們在狂烈的風雨中，艱難地跋涉過積水。

sentences.english: This might involve going on a long journey or sending a communication by messenger.
sentences.chinese: 與人交流很可能需要長途跋涉，或派使者送信。

sentences.english: I was beaten out by the long and difficult journey.
sentences.chinese: 長途艱辛跋涉使我困頓不堪。

sentences.english: Her feet blistered during the long hike.
sentences.chinese: 長途跋涉中她的腳起泡了。

sentences.english: We tramped through the wood for over two hours until we arrived at a deep stream.
sentences.chinese: 我們在樹林中跋涉了兩個多小時，到了一條深溪邊。

sentences.english: The old man trudged through the deep snow back towards home.
sentences.chinese: 老人在深雪中跋涉走向家中。

sentences.english: It took us a week to trek to the foot of the mountain.
sentences.chinese: 我們花了一星期才跋涉到山腳。

sentences.english: Therefore, Wu Wer's life and love journey is worth our speculating.
sentences.chinese: 由此，吳爲的人生跋涉與情感履歷值得我們深思。

definition: to travel over land and water (idiom)
to pass over mountains ridges (idiom); fig. hardships of the journey
to climb mountains and wade rivers (idiom); fig. to make a long and difficult journey
to rush about/to be constantly on the move
